intro: Bergia peploides, commonly known as the sandbergia, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in areas subject to salt spray. Its flowers are usually small, star-shaped, and come in shades of pink or white. Bergia peploides is well adapted to arid conditions and can survive in harsh coastal environments.
